alert.note: Alert for Charlotte (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 07 at 7:33PM EDT by NWS Blacksburg
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southeastern Charlotte County through 745 PM EDT... At 733 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Wylliesburg, or 7 miles northwest of Chase City, moving southeast at 15 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph, pea size hail and locally heavy rain. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This storm will remain over mainly rural areas of southeastern Charlotte County. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Locally heavy rain, with rates up to three inches per hour, will quickly reduce visibility and result in ponding of water on roadways, standing water in low lying areas, and minor flooding of creeks, streams, and areas of poor drainage. Drivers are urged to slow down and use extra caution to avoid hydroplaning.
